projects.title: Veribadge
projects.description: A service to verify qualifications online and use them by linking with various platforms.

detail.summary: This is a service that allows users to prove their qualifications on social platforms flooded with AI comments and fake engagement. Users can upload certificates (e.g., medical license, income proof) to generate a badge tag. When the generated tag is used in a comment and the browser extension is installed, the tag is converted into a badge for other users to see.

challenges.title: Deciding on Kakao Login Token Delivery and Parsing Method
challenges.problem: After Kakao login, the token delivery path was unclear, causing issues where the token couldn't be read at the SSR/middleware stage or was missed during frontend parsing.
causes: Frontend cannot access the token when passed in the Body of a redirect response from the backend
HttpOnly Cookies cannot be shared due to domain constraints
Parsing issues occurred when using a URL #fragment in the redirect
resolution: The initial plan (backend handles login, then an additional request from the frontend) was shelved due to time/implementation costs
Safely parsed the fragment on the callback page → stored the token → removed the hash using router.replace
lessons: Constraints like redirect body invisibility, cookie Domain/SameSite, CORS, and SSR/CSR differences must be considered upfront in token strategy
Learned the difference between `?query` (server-visible, SSR-friendly) and `#fragment` (client-visible, requires CSR parsing) in OAuth redirects

challenges.title: API Call Path Confusion Issue
challenges.problem: Page navigation via href worked correctly, but a 404 error occurred on refresh.
causes: This occurred due to a mismatch between frontend routing (/page path) and the actual server routing.

In the local dev environment, http://localhost:3000/page is handled by Next.js, but in the deployment environment (or with an incorrect API address), the server tries to find /page directly, causing a 404.
resolution: The issue was resolved by replacing the API call address from localhost to the actual server address.
lessons: Even if it works in CSR (client-side routing), a refresh (F5) sends an SSR request to the server, so server routing must be configured accordingly
API paths (/api/...) and page paths (/page) must be distinguished and called with the correct address.

challenges.title: HttpOnly Cookie Domain Mismatch Issue
challenges.problem: After fetching a token in middleware, the token would disappear when navigating to another page.
causes: The backend server used a subdomain while the frontend used the main domain. The backend set the cookie domain to its subdomain, causing a domain mismatch.
resolution: Adjusted the cookie's Domain attribute to the main domain, making it accessible to all subdomains.
lessons: Deepened understanding of login session persistence and domain/cookie policies.

challenges.title: TanStack Query Data Synchronization Issue
challenges.problem: Changes made on the dashboard were not immediately reflected in the sidebar.
causes: The sidebar and dashboard used the same data but called different APIs and lacked cache handling.
The sidebar was located in the root layout, so it did not re-render on page navigation.
resolution: When data on the dashboard changed, invalidated the sidebar-related query with invalidateQuery to synchronize with the latest data.
lessons: Learned the importance of query invalidation and state synchronization to ensure data consistency.
